com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable

Class ComponentBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ComponentBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Evaluator, Evolver, History, Monitor, Mutator, Population, Ranker, Recombiner, Run, Speciator, Transcriber

    public abstract class ComponentBase
extends ConfigurableBase

    A base class for classes that represent a user-configurable component of the software. ComponentBase extends ConfigurableBase so supports user-configurable fields, such as "value" fields and {link Prototype} fields. It also provides functionality to support working with components whose sub-class may be specified at run-time, the instantiation of components which may depend on other components being initialised first (and the detection of dependency cycles), organising components hierarchically, a unified approach to monitoring the state of components, and retrieving the current configuration of a component (and all-subcomponents hierarchically).

    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • parentComponent

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentBase

        public ComponentBase(ComponentBase parentComponent,
             Configuration componentConfig)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates and configures this component and any Components with the given configuration. Sub-classes must implement a constructor accepting the same parameters and call super(parentComponent, componentConfig). Overriding implementations of this constructor should return after calling super() if null is provided for the componentConfig parameter (null is used to create dummy instances when printing the available default configuration options).
        Parameters:
        parentComponent - The parent component, if applicable.
        componentConfig - The configuration for the this component and, recursively, it's sub-components.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurred instantiating Components or setting parameter field values.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllStateData

        public final com.google.common.collect.Multimap<java.lang.String,ComponentStateLog> getAllStateData()
        Provides information about the current state of this Component and its sub-Components, if any. Useful for a Monitor or similar that is observing the Component.
        Returns:
        The state logs for this and all sub-Components. The keys are the Components class name, and for sub-Components this Components class name and the sub-Components class name separated by a iterationPeriod, and so on.
        See Also:
        getState()

      • getState

        public java.util.List<ComponentStateLog> getState()
        Sub-classes may override this to provide information (usually simple statistics) about their current state. This is useful for a Monitor or similar that is observing the Component. It is generally a good idea to call the super-method if overriding this method (except for the version defined on ComponentBase itself which does nothing).

      • getComponentFields

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getComponentFields()

      • getConfiguration

        public com.eclipsesource.json.JsonObject getConfiguration(boolean includeMetaData)
                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Gets the current configuration of this component.
        Overrides:
        getConfiguration in class ConfigurableBase
        Parameters:
        includeMetaData - Whether or not to include the meta-data for the parameters and Components.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getSubComponent

        public java.lang.Object getSubComponent(java.lang.String fieldName,
                               ComponentBase requestingComponent)
        Returns the instance for a sub-Component of this Component (referenced via a field annotated with Component), initialising it if necessary. This method should be called from the Constructors of other components when they require access to another Component (which may not have been initialised yet). This method should not typically be used outside of the constructor for a Component as it is not very efficient; sub-Components should typically be accessed via get methods defined on the parent Component.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field referencing the sub-Component.
        requestingComponent - The component making the request. This is used for detecting and reporting initialisation loops.
        Returns:
        The requested Component or array of Components, depending on the Component field type.

      • getParentComponent

        public <T extends ComponentBase> T getParentComponent(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Returns the instance for the parent component with the given class, or null if no such parent component exists.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the desired parent component. Any sub- or super-class of the desired parent component may be specified.
